ArticleTitle.sentence: Cooperation between core binding factor and adjacent promoter elements contributes to the tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3.

event.clue: Cooperation between core binding factor and adjacent promoter elements contributes to the tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3.
Cooperation between core binding factor and adjacent promoter elements contributes to the tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3.
Cooperation between core binding factor and adjacent promoter elements contributes to the tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3.

AbstractText.sentence: Tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3 (IL-3) is mediated via cis-acting elements located within 315 base pairs of the transcription start.

event.clue: Tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3 (IL-3) is mediated via cis-acting elements located within 315 base pairs of the transcription start.
Tissue-specific expression of interleukin-3 (IL-3) is mediated via cis-acting elements located within 315 base pairs of the transcription start.

AbstractText.sentence: This is achieved in part through the positive activities of the AP-1 and Elf-1 sites in the IL-3 promoter.

event.clue: This is achieved in part through the positive activities of the AP-1 and Elf-1 sites in the IL-3 promoter.
This is achieved in part through the positive activities of the AP-1 and Elf-1 sites in the IL-3 promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: The contribution to T cell-specific expression by other promoter sites was assessed in a transient expression assay with IL-3 promoter constructs linked to a luciferase gene, focusing initially on the core binding factor (CBF) site, which is footprinted in vivo upon T cell activation.

event.clue: The contribution to T cell-specific expression by other promoter sites was assessed in a transient expression assay with IL-3 promoter constructs linked to a luciferase gene, focusing initially on the core binding factor (CBF) site, which is footprinted in vivo upon T cell activation.

AbstractText.sentence: Activity of the CBF site is shown to be critically dependent on the adjacent activator site Act-1.

event.clue: Activity of the CBF site is shown to be critically dependent on the adjacent activator site Act-1.

AbstractText.sentence: Together the Act-1 and CBF sites form a functional unit (AC unit) with dual activity.

event.clue: Together the Act-1 and CBF sites form a functional unit (AC unit) with dual activity.

AbstractText.sentence: The AC unit is demonstrated to enhance basal activity of promoters both in fibroblasts and T cells.

event.clue: The AC unit is demonstrated to enhance basal activity of promoters both in fibroblasts and T cells.
The AC unit is demonstrated to enhance basal activity of promoters both in fibroblasts and T cells.
The AC unit is demonstrated to enhance basal activity of promoters both in fibroblasts and T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: This activity is further inducible in activated T cells, but not in fibroblasts.

event.clue: This activity is further inducible in activated T cells, but not in fibroblasts.
This activity is further inducible in activated T cells, but not in fibroblasts.

AbstractText.sentence: In addition to the already identified NIP repressor site, evidence is presented for a second repressor region that restricts promoter activity in fibroblasts.

event.clue: In addition to the already identified NIP repressor site, evidence is presented for a second repressor region that restricts promoter activity in fibroblasts.
In addition to the already identified NIP repressor site, evidence is presented for a second repressor region that restricts promoter activity in fibroblasts.

AbstractText.sentence: Finally, a novel positive regulatory element has been mapped in the IL-3 promoter between nucleotide -180 and -210 that leads to increased expression in T cells.

event.clue: Finally, a novel positive regulatory element has been mapped in the IL-3 promoter between nucleotide -180 and -210 that leads to increased expression in T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Together these results demonstrate that T cell expression of IL-3 is not specified by the activity of a single tissue-specific element, but instead involves multiple interacting elements that provide both specific positive regulation in T cells and specific negative regulation in fibroblasts.

event.clue: Together these results demonstrate that T cell expression of IL-3 is not specified by the activity of a single tissue-specific element, but instead involves multiple interacting elements that provide both specific positive regulation in T cells and specific negative regulation in fibroblasts.
